results.title: Two languages are better than one
results.creator_credit: John Moore, Open Channel Productions and Jan Denton
results.brief_description: A bilingual program offers instruction in two languages. Substantial community support is required to successfully establish a bilingual program. This may be forcoming if people are provided with sufficient information upon which to base fruitful discussion. This video provides a starting point for such discussion.

results.title: Two in the bush: the Attic of the world
results.creator_credit: Christopher Parsons and ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Two in the Bush”.
The naturalist, Gerald Durrell, observes Australian wild life. On a sheep farm he sees the problems kangaroos pose for farmers and meets some scientists doing field work on “roos”. He also sees the birth of a kangaroo, and its trip into its mother’s pouch. Research on the breeding biology of animals is also seen.

results.title: Two hours of christmas cartoons
results.creator_credit: Hughes Leisure Group and Music World
results.brief_description: A compilation of cartoons from the forties and fifties which feature classic stories such as ‘Rudolph the red-nosed reindeer’, ‘Santa’s surprise’, ‘Jingle bell foolin’, ‘Christmas circus’ and a host of other titles guaranteed to generate lots of Christmas spirit.

results.title: Two hands
results.creator_credit: Marian MacGowan, CML, Meridian Films and Gregor Jordan
results.brief_description: Set in Sydney’s King’s Cross, 19 year old Jimmy (Heath Ledger) finds himself in debt to a local gangster, Pando, played by perennial Australian actor Bryan Brown, when a simple job goes wrong. Jimmy’s life depends on his locating the $10,000 he has lost. As his scheme to replace the cash is played out, two street kids are enjoying a shopping spree with the original loot. The black humour of the film progressively darkens as the story unfolds. Rose Byrne co-stars as country girl, Alex, who becomes involved with Jimmy and his increasingly dire situation.

results.title: Two grasslands: Texas and Iran
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comparative cultures and geography”
Compares the Edwards Plateau in Texas and the steppes of Iran as regions similar in rainfall pattern and sparsity of vegetation. Explores the lifestyles of the people of the two regions to reveal the interrelationship between land, technology and culture.

results.title: Two Girls and a Baby
results.creator_credit: Penny Robins, Annamax Media and Kelli Simpson
results.brief_description: An entertaining look at the IVF process from the point of view of a lesbian couple as they deal with sperm banks, relationships, baby clothes, and community resistance.

results.title: Two Friends
results.brief_description: A film about the troubled middle teenage years of two school girls, exploring the change in their relationship over a year. Louise and Kelly were good friends but as the year progresses, the two girls grow apart. The story is told in five separate periods over the year. It begins in the present and ends in the past. Written by Helen Garner.

results.title: Two farms: Wisconsin, Hungary
results.creator_credit: John H. Secondari, Learning Corporation of America, Helen Jean Secondari and Richard Kuhne
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comparative cultures and geography”
Contrasts farm life in Wisconsin and southeastern Hungary following one family in each rural area through a daily routine. Features members of the families commenting on how their farms operate and what they find satisfying in their lives.
